info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 06 at 6:55PM CDT until May 13 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN DAVIESS...NORTHWESTERN GRUNDY...SOUTHWESTERN MERCER AND SOUTHEASTERN HARRISON COUNTIES... At 655 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Gilman City, or 8 miles south of Bethany, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and two inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Bethany, Gilman City, Coffey, Brimson and Modena. This includes Interstate 35 in Missouri between mile markers 82 and 93. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
